STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 22, 2024
Charles Rose
Chippewa/Luce/Mackinac County DHHS
463 E 3 MILE RD,
SAULT S MARIE, MI, 49783-9476
RE: License#: CP170201061
Dear Mr. Rose:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
11/19/24. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI. 49684
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
RENEWAL INSPECTION REPORT

Name of Agency: Chippewa/Luce/Mackinac County DHHS

SAULT S MARIE, MI 49783-9476

children in foster home, Supervise
Independent Living

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (a) Reason for the change in placement.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files reviewed did not
complete a DHS-69 and document reason for change of placement.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (e) Replacement preparation of all
relevant parties, including the child or
infant, which includes an explanation as
to why the change is necessary.

One of three files reviewed did not complete a DHS-69 and document
replacement preparation of all relevant parties, including the child or infant, which
i ncludes an explanation as to why the change is necessary.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (h) The child's new location and address.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files reviewed did not
complete a DHS-69 and document the child's new location and address.
CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (i) That the current foster parent was
notified in writing of the following
information:
• (i) Not less than 14 calendar days
in advance, of the change, except
when prior notification would
jeopardize the child's care or
safety. If prior notice is not
provided, then the agency shall
notify the foster parent, at the time
of the change, why prior notice
was not given.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files reviewed did not
complete a DHS-69 and document that the current foster parent was notified in
writing of the following information: Not less than 14 calendar days in advance, of
the change, except when prior notification would jeopardize the child's care or
safety. If prior notice is not provided, then the agency shall notify the foster
parent, at the time of the change, why prior notice was not given.

CPA Rule 400.12405 Change of placement
• (3) The agency shall document all the following
in the child's record before a change of
placement occurs:
• (j) Supervisory approval before the
change.
Three foster care files were reviewed. One of three files reviewed did not
complete a DHS-69 and document supervisory approval before the change.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (a) Child's name.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received the childs name before placement or replacement of the
child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (b) Child's date of birth.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received the childs date of birth.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:

• (c) Available known information about the
child's health.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received all known information about the childs health at placement
or replacement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (d) Any known history of abuse or neglect
of the child.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received all known history of abuse or neglect of the child before
p lacement or replacement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (e) All known emotional and
psychological factors relating to the care
of the child.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received all known emotional and psychological factors relating to
the care of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (f) All known behaviors of the child.

Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received all known behaviors of the child before placement or
r eplacement.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (g) Circumstances necessitating
placement or replacement of the child.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received information regarding circumstances necessitating
p lacement or replacement of the child.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:
• (h) Any other known information to enable
the foster parent to provide a stable, safe,
and healthy environment for the foster
child and the foster family, including
information about siblings who do not
reside in the foster home as provided in
federal law.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
foster parent received any other known information to enable the foster parent to
provide a stable, safe, and healthy environment for the foster child and the foster
family, including information about siblings who do not reside in the foster home
as provided in federal law.
CPA Rule 400.12417 Foster parent information
• (1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with
all the following information before the
placement or replacement of a child:

• (i) Name of assigned social service
worker.
Three foster care files were reviewed. Two of three files did not document that the
f oster parent received the name of assigned social service worker.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incident reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents
named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was informed
that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be
reviewed with the agency at three months and six months. The assigned
Consultant for the agency will work with the agency in conducting CAP
reviews. This process for special investigation CAP reviews was implemented
previously.
• Uploading Documents: Technical assistance was provided regarding the
timely uploading of documents. There were several incidents of documents
that were not uploaded and the consultant needed to request the documents
which were completed but not uploaded. The agency was informed that
documents need to be uploaded and ready for audit reviews.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency was cited for three rule/policy violations during the 11/29/23 Interim
inspection and an approved corrective action plan was submitted on 12/27/23. The
violations were, R 400.12510 Independent living agreement, FOM 722-08D
Treatment Plans, and FOM 801-03 Medical Passport. The current Renewal
inspection did not establish repeat violations thus indicating the agency CAP was
successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Annual Assessment was reviewed. The assessment
addressed rule and policy violations established during the 2023 Interim
Inspection and the agency efforts to correct and prevent repeat violations.
The assessment also identified barriers to compliance. They are in part and
quoted as follows:
- Tracking was not sufficient via supervisor only as the USP dates are not every 90
days when the approval path timeframes are included, thus leading to overdue
agreements.
- Confusion on due dates for signatures as staff focused on the USP due date,
after approval.
- Sending out reports a month ahead of time was too far as emergencies and
other immediate issues arose in foster care.
- Medical and dental exams for youth that are in SIL or YAVFC that are not willing
to participate in exams to sign a waiver which is not recognized by policy or
MISEP.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS agency and therefore financial records were not
available for review.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported that their respective supervisors are supportive of them and are
knowledgeable about foster care. Staff reported supervisors can offer quality
support and direction regarding concerns or questions workers may have. Staff
also reported that they feel they are part of a supportive team which pulls together
when needed to get agency responsibilities completed and provide quality care for
children and families.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern, well equipped building in Sault Ste Marie.
There is sufficient office space. CHRI documents were observed to be stored
securely.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified three safety alerts during visits to the homes. They are as
follows:
Safety Alert #1. The safety alert was generated on 10/02/24 as firearms were not
safely stored. The firearms were without trigger locks and were not stored in a
manufactured safe.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 10/07/24 as trigger locks were installed and
the guns stored in a safe in the master bedroom. Photos of the trigger locked firearms
were submitted.
Safety Alert #2. The safety alert was generated on 10/17/24 as a smoke alarm was
missing between the parent bedroom and the rest of the house.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 1024/24 as a smoke alarm was installed
between the parent bedroom and the rest of the home. Photos were submitted and
uploaded.
Safety Alert #3. The safety alert was generated on 10/22/24 as smoke alarms were
missing between the children's bedroom and the rest of the home. A smoke alarm
was also missing between the master bedroom and the rest of the room. A smoke
alarm was missing in the basement.
Resolution: At the time of this audit and report, resolution has not yet been obtained.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
November 21, 2024
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 22, 2024
_____________________________________
Samantha Way Date
Area Manager
